attributes.action: Keep the Links Project in Edinburgh open
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Links Project is under threat of closure with no clear explanation why. There is no alternative service available in Edinburgh.  This would leave a massive gap in residential addiction crisis support. There will be consequences for our communities if the Links closes.  The Links offers individual support in the following ways:
Drug misuse management, Resolving practical difficulties, Reduction in HIV risk taking behaviour and physical harm, Overall health gain during stay, Arranging community support, Prepare and plan towards a successful discharge
The Links provides the following services:  Detoxification, Harm reduction, Respite service, Key worker system, Individual support, Group work, A safe environment
"If the Links was not here I don't think I would have got my life back. If I have learned anything it would be that we need more places like this it has been the best experience of my life so far." (A resident)

rejection.details: This is a devolved matter and should be directed to the Scottish Executive.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
